alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 14 at 2:17PM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 7 to 12 inches, except 13 to 20 inches for the higher terrain of the Twin Ports and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Carlton and South St. Louis County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Fond du Lac Band. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS..A brief lull in snowfall intensity occurs this afternoon and evening. Expect heavy snow to redevelop Wednesday night into Thursday.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
